ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: FERC Electric Tariff First Revised Volume No. 1

record_data.record_plain_text: RATE SCHEDULE WS-DV WHOLESALE SERVICE AVAILABILITY This schedule applies to electric service sold to Customers who purchase electric energy for resale, delivered from the General Distribution System of the Company where capacity and facilities are available. Service will be supplied under an Electric Service Agreement setting forth the financial conditions covering the extension of service, the period of service and the conditions of supply. CHARACTER OF SERVICE DELIVERED UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Alternating current service having the following characteristics: Three phase, 60 cycles, 7200/12,470 volts and below. At the option of the Company, lower voltages may be used subject to correction for losses to the primary delivery voltages specified. MONTHLY RATE Customer Charge $6.65 Net Energy Charge $.05236 Net per kilowatt-hour Tax Adjustment An adjustment for tax changes shall apply to all kilowatt-hours billed under this rate schedule. Rates to be adjusted, as required, by including an automatic pass-through of changes in federal, state, or local taxes or tax rates by providing an automatic adjustment of all taxes, upward or downward, based on actual tax expense incurred by West Penn. Fuel Cost Adjustment A fuel cost adjustment shall apply to all kilowatt-hours billed under this rate schedule. The adjustment shall be determined by the following formula to the nearest 0.001 cent per kilowatt-hour: A={ Fm Fb} x L Sm Sb A = Fuel cost adjustment in cents per kilowatt-hour. Fm = Fuel cost in the current period relating to: (a)Fossil and nuclear fuel consumed in generation in wholly-owned and jointly-owned stations and identifiable fossil and nuclear fuel costs in energy purchased plus the net energy cost of energy purchased on an economic dispatch basis less (b)Fossil and nuclear fuel costs recovered through intersystem sales. All fuel costs will be those charged to Account 501, cleared through Account 151, and Account 518 in the second calendar month preceding the billing month. Sm = All kilowatt-hour sales to regular customers in the current period. Fb and Sb = Fuel and kilowatt-hour sales in the base period as defined above. The factor Fb = 1.200 cent per kilowatt-hour. Sb L = Adjustment factor to recognize losses to service voltage where different than average losses in the delivery system. This factor is 1.00. Late Payment Charge A late payment charge of 2% of the bill on the above net rates, including the Fuel Cost Adjustment, will be made for failure to make payment in full within 15 days of the date of a bill. MINIMUM BILL UNDER THIS SCHEDULE The minimum bill under this schedule shall not be less than one-half the highest bill (excluding Fuel Cost Adjustment) during the last preceding twelve months that the Customer has taken service under this schedule. GENERAL A mutually agreed-upon kilowatt-hour adjustment may be determined for connections on this schedule, then apportioned to each account to compensate for transformer losses. The Company s Rules and Regulations which govern the supply of wholesale service, as included in this FERC tariff and as changed from time to time, apply to this Schedule and are hereby incorporated by reference. Nothing contained herein shall be construed as affecting in any way the right of any party hereto to unilaterally make application to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for a change in rates under Section 205 or 206 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to the Commission s Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder. If Customer terminates or cancels service under the Tariff, the Customer shall remain responsible for its share of any legitimate and verifiable stranded investment costs related to the service Customer purchases under this Schedule as may be permitted by applicable federal or state rules and regulations, policies or interpretation. TERM As provided in the Electric Service Agreement, but not less than one year.
record_data.filing_title: West Penn Power Company Baseline Tariff filing

record_data.record_plain_text: SCHEDULE WS-LV1 WHOLESALE SERVICE AVAILABILITY Available only to Customers served on or before April 1, 1997 for electric service sold to Customers who purchase electric energy for resale. Service will be supplied under an Electric Service Agreement setting forth the financial conditions covering the extension of service, the period of service and the conditions of supply. CHARACTER OF SERVICE DELIVERED UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Alternating current service having the following characteristics: Three phase, 60 cycles, 25,000 volts and below. At the option of the Company, lower voltages may be used subject to correction for losses to the primary delivery voltage specified. MONTHLY RATE Customer Charge $74.00 Net Transmission & Distribution Charge $4.643 Net per kilowatt Generation Charge $.01827 Net per kilowatt-hour $5.433 Net per kilowatt Automatic Tax Adjustment An adjustment for tax changes shall apply, as appropriate, to the kilowatt-hours or kilowatts billed under this rate schedule. Rates to be adjusted, as required, by including an automatic pass-through of changes in federal, state, or local taxes or tax rates by providing an automatic adjustment of all taxes, upward or downward, based on actual tax expense incurred by West Penn. For changes in tax expense related to the Federal Corporate Income Tax rate, the appropriate dollar amount shall be applied to all schedules on an apportioned demand basis. For all other taxes or tax rate changes, unless otherwise agreed to by the Parties, the appropriate dollar amount shall be applied to all schedules on an apportioned kilowatt-hour basis. Fuel Cost Adjustment A fuel cost adjustment shall apply to all kilowatt-hours billed under this rate schedule. The adjustment shall be determined by the following formula to the nearest 0.001 cent per kilowatt-hour: A={ Fm Fb} x L x 1 . Sm Sb 1-T A = Fuel cost adjustment in cents per kilowatt-hour. Fm = Fuel cost in the current period relating to: (a)Fossil and nuclear fuel consumed in generation in wholly-owned and jointly-owned stations and identifiable fossil and nuclear fuel costs in energy purchased plus the net energy cost of energy purchased on an economic dispatch basis less (b)Fossil and nuclear fuel costs recovered through intersystem sales. All fuel costs will be those charged to Account 501, cleared through Account 151, and Account 518 in the second calendar month preceding the billing month. Sm = All kilowatt-hour sales to regular customers in the current period. Fb and Sb = Fuel and kilowatt-hour sales in the base period as defined above. The factor Fb = 1.200 cent per kilowatt-hour. Sb L = Adjustment factor to recognize losses to service voltage where different than average losses in the delivery system. This factor is 1.00. T = The Gross Receipts Tax rate in effect during the billing month, expressed as a decimal. Late Payment Charge A late payment charge of 2% of the bill on the above net rates, including the Fuel Cost Adjustment, will be made for failure to make payment in full within 15 days of the date of a bill. DETERMINATION OF CUSTOMER S DEMAND The Customer s kilowatt demand for any month shall be the maximum thirty minute kilowatt demand. The Customer s kilowatt demand shall not be less than the higher of the following: (a)100 kilowatts. (b)50% of the highest Customer s kilowatt demand established during the current contract period. GENERAL The Company s Rules and Regulations which govern the supply of wholesale service, as included in this FERC tariff and as changed from time to time, apply to this Schedule and are hereby incorporated by reference. Nothing contained herein shall be construed as affecting in any way the right of any party hereto to unilaterally make application to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for a change in rates under Section 205 or 206 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to the Commission s Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder. TERM As provided in the Electric Service Agreement, but not less than one year.
record_data.filing_title: West Penn Power Company Baseline Tariff filing

record_data.record_plain_text: RATE SCHEDULE WS-LV WHOLESALE SERVICE AVAILABILITY This schedule applies to electric service sold to Customers who purchase electric energy for resale. Service will be supplied under an Electric Service Agreement setting forth the financial conditions covering the extension of service, the period of service and the conditions of supply. CHARACTER OF SERVICE DELIVERED UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Alternating current service having the following characteristics: Three phase, 60 cycles, 25,000 volts and below. At the option of the Company, lower voltages may be used subject to correction for losses to the primary delivery voltage specified. MONTHLY RATE Customer Charge $74.00 Net Demand Charge $11.406 Net per kilowatt Energy Charge $.01923 Net per kilowatt-hour Voltage Discount If requested, the Company will furnish service at 25,000 volts at a location if such service at that location is over 500 kilowatts, is provided at a single delivery point from the Company s system, is the only service on that account, and if, in the sole judgment of the Company, the necessary capacity is available. When such service is supplied and the Customer owns and maintains all facilities except metering equipment, required to take service at 25,000 volts, the following discounts will be allowed, but in no case will the amount of the minimum bill be hereby reduced. First 500 kilowatts of Customer s Demand . . . . . $0.45 Net per Kilowatt Next 4,500 kilowatts of Customer s Demand . . . .$0.17 Net per Kilowatt To qualify for this voltage service, the Customer must be billed for at least 500 kilowatts at least once in every 12-month period at each metering point. Automatic Tax Adjustment An adjustment for tax changes shall apply, as appropriate, to the kilowatt-hours or kilowatts billed under this rate schedule. Rates to be adjusted, as required, by including an automatic pass-through of changes in federal, state, or local taxes or tax rates by providing an automatic adjustment of all taxes, upward or downward, based on actual tax expense incurred by West Penn. For changes in tax expense related to the Federal Corporate Income Tax rate, the appropriate dollar amount shall be applied to all schedules on an apportioned demand basis. For all other taxes or tax rate changes, unless otherwise agreed to by the Parties, the appropriate dollar amount shall be applied to all schedules on an apportioned kilowatt-hour basis. Fuel Cost Adjustment A fuel cost adjustment shall apply to all kilowatt-hours billed under this rate schedule. The adjustment shall be determined by the following formula to the nearest 0.001 cent per kilowatt-hour: A={ Fm Fb} x L x 1 Sm Sb 1-T A = Fuel cost adjustment in cents per kilowatt-hour. Fm = Fuel cost in the current period relating to: (a)Fossil and nuclear fuel consumed in generation in wholly-owned and jointly-owned stations and identifiable fossil and nuclear fuel costs in energy purchased plus the net energy cost of energy purchased on an economic dispatch basis less (b)Fossil and nuclear fuel costs recovered through intersystem sales. All fuel costs will be those charged to Account 501, cleared through Account 151, and Account 518 in the second calendar month preceding the billing month. Sm = All kilowatt-hour sales to regular customers in the current period. Fb and Sb = Fuel and kilowatt-hour sales in the base period as defined above. The factor Fb = 1.200 cent per kilowatt-hour. Sb L = Adjustment factor to recognize losses to service voltage where different than average losses in the delivery system. This factor is 1.00 for service voltage below 25,000 volts and 0.97 for service voltage of 25,000 volts. T = The Gross Receipts Tax rate in effect during the billing month, expressed as a decimal. Late Payment Charge A late payment charge of 2% of the bill on the above net rates, including the Fuel Cost Adjustment, will be made for failure to make payment in full within 15 days of the date of a bill. DETERMINATION OF CUSTOMER S DEMAND The Customer s kilowatt demand for any month shall be the maximum thirty minute kilowatt demand. The Customer s kilowatt demand shall not be less than the higher of the following: (a)100 kilowatts. (b)50% of the highest Customer s kilowatt demand established during the current contract period. GENERAL The Company s Rules and Regulations which govern the supply of wholesale service, as included in this FERC tariff and as changed from time to time, apply to this Schedule and are hereby incorporated by reference. Nothing contained herein shall be construed as affecting in any way the right of any party hereto to unilaterally make application to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for a change in rates under Section 205 or 206 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to the Commission s Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder. If Customer terminates or cancels service under the Tariff, the Customer shall remain responsible for its share of any legitimate and verifiable stranded investment costs related to the service Customer purchases under this Schedule as may be permitted by applicable federal or state rules and regulations, policies or interpretation. TERM As provided in the Electric Service Agreement, but not less than one year.

record_data.record_plain_text: ELECTRIC FORM OF SERVICE AGREEMENT This Agreement, to be effective on , , by and between West Penn Power Company ( Company ), a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, and ( Customer ). WITNESSETH That for and in consideration of the covenants and agreements herein contained, it is mutually agreed as follows: 1)The Company shall sell and deliver to the Customer, and the Customer shall purchase and receive from the Company, all of the electric power and energy specified for each delivery point by the Customer, as shown on Appendix A hereof, as amended from time to time. 2)New delivery points may be added, as required, to Appendix A from time to time. The capacity specified for each delivery point, if applicable, shall be included on Appendix A and such estimates may be revised from time to time by the Customer as agreed upon within the limits as set forth in the Rate Schedule and the Rules and Regulations. For purposes of System safety, reliability, and planning, the Company may limit the capacity at each delivery point. Such limitation shall not relieve the obligation of the Company to furnish the power for other delivery points as specified by the Customer, as shown on Appendix A, within the limits of the Rate Schedule and the Rules and Regulations. 3)The Customer agrees to take and pay for electric service supplied by the Company in accordance with the Rules and Regulations and Rate Schedule as set out in the Company s FERC Electric Tariff First Revised Volume No. 1 presently in effect, and as may be amended from time to time. 4)The initial term of this Agreement for each delivery point now or hereafter served under this Agreement shall be one (1) year1 from the date service commences at such delivery point with renewals of one (1) year* thereafter. This Agreement may be terminated at the end of the initial or any subsequent term by either party giving three (3) months* prior written notice to the other of such termination. 5)This Agreement is made subject to the jurisdiction of any governmental authorities having jurisdiction in the premises, and either party may, at any time or from time to time, unilaterally take any action before or with such authorities with respect to any rates, terms, conditions or services of this Agreement that it deems desirable, and in such event, the rates, terms or conditions under which service shall be rendered hereunder shall be those authorized by such authorities. 6)This Agreement, together with the Rules and Regulations and applicable Rate Schedule constitutes the entire contract between the Company and the Customer and supersedes and cancels all prior agreements (inconsistent herewith) as of the effective date hereof. 7)This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their successors and assigns. (If Appropriate: 8)This Agreement shall not be binding upon the parties unless approved by the Administrator of the Rural Electrification Administration or his duly authorized representative.) IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Agreement to be signed and sealed by their duly authorized officers. ATTEST: WEST PENN POWER COMPANY By ATTEST: CUSTOMER By

record_data.filing_title: West Penn Power Company Baseline Tariff filing

record_data.record_plain_text: Description of Company Service West Penn Power Company is engaged as a public utility in the business of generating, transmitting, distributing and selling electric energy to various classifications of retail customers in 23 counties in the North Central, South Central, and Southwestern parts of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, subject to the regulation of the Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission under the law of Pennsylvania. The Company also sells electric energy at wholesale to a rural electric cooperative, municipalities and public utilities within the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
record_data.filing_title: West Penn Power Company Baseline Tariff filing

record_data.record_plain_text: RULES AND REGULATIONS The following Rules and Regulations govern the supply of wholesale electric service by West Penn Power Company. 1.Definitions 1.1Certain words, when used in the Rules and Regulations, Rate Schedules and Agreements of West Penn Power Company, shall have the following meanings: 1.1.1 Customer : Any wholesale customer to whom the Company may furnish wholesale service and which is either 1) operating a distribution system and selling electric service to retail customers; or 2) selling electric service to its member electric cooperatives. 1.1.2 Company : West Penn Power Company. 1.1.3 Service : Any electricity which the Company may supply or make provision to supply, or any work or material furnished, or any obligation performed by the Company under its Rules and Regulations or Rate Schedules. 1.1.4 Month : The period between two consecutive monthly meter readings taken, as nearly as practicable, on the same date of each calendar month, as selected by the Company. 1.1.5 Service Connection : Each connection through which the Company furnishes electric service to the Customer. 2.Service Availability 2.1Character of Electric Service 2.1.1Depending upon the size, character, and geographic location of the Customer s load, the Company will supply from its overhead system 60 cycle alternating current at one of the following three phase voltages: Phase Wires Voltage (Nominal) 3 4 7200/12,470 3 3 25,000 3 3 34,500 3 3 46,000 3 3 69,000 3 3 138,000 2.1.2 Inasmuch as some of the above voltages are available only in certain sections of the territory served by the Company, it is necessary that the Customer consult the Company about the type of service that will be supplied before proceeding with the installation of wiring or the purchase of equipment. 2.1.3 Other voltages may be available, depending on the Company s facilities and the Customer s requirements, if specifically negotiated. 2.2Capacity 2.2.1The Company s existing facilities have a limited capacity; therefore, to assure satisfactory operation of the Customer s facilities and to protect both the Customer s and Company s facilities against damage, the Company must be advised of any substantial change in the amount or use of the Customer s load so that Company facilities of the proper capacity may be installed; provided however, that such change shall be subject to the availability of power on the Company s system and to agreement between the parties on such devices or arrangements as may be required to insure the reliability of both systems. The Customer shall pay for any damage or loss caused to the Company by violation of this provision. 2.3Liability 2.3.1The Customer, by accepting service from the company, assumes full responsibility for the safety and adequacy of the wiring and equipment installed on the Customer s system. Customer agrees to indemnify and save the Company harmless from any liability which may arise as the result of the use of service supplied to the Customer by the Company 2.4Use of Equipment 2.4.1The Customer shall refrain from any acts, transactions, and uses of equipment, appliances, or devices which may have a significant adverse effect upon the reliability or characteristics of the Company s system. 2.4.2Service provided under this tariff is subject to power service voltage regulation. 3.Agreement for Service 3.1Each Customer shall enter into an agreement of substantially the form set out in this FERC Electric Tariff or such other form as may be required in cases involving the supply of emergency, standby, or breakdown service. 4.Right of Way 4.1The facilities of the Company, by which service is furnished, shall be located on or over easements which will provide a route deemed by the Company to be the most suitable for the furnishing of such service. In consideration of the furnishing of service by the Company, the Customer shall cause such rights and easements to be provided to the Company on property controlled by the Customer at no cost to the Company and as the Company shall deem necessary and convenient to permit the construction, operation and maintenance of the Company s facilities required to serve the Customer. It shall not be the obligation of the Company to acquire any right or easement on or over property of another necessary for the furnishing of service to the Customer for which acquisition the Company does not have the right of eminent domain. 5.Maintenance and Removal 5.1Facilities provided by the Company are the property of the Company and shall remain its property. The Customer shall permit the Company to inspect, maintain, repair, and remove the Company s facilities at all reasonable hours. When practical, notice to the Customer shall be provided in advance of such work. 6.Customer s Facilities 6.1The Customer shall pay the cost of relocating its facilities if such relocation is necessary to conform with a relocation of the Company s facilities as required by law or public improvements. 7.Company s Facilities 7.1The Customer shall pay the cost of moving the Company s facilities if they are moved at the Customer s Request. 8.Continuity of Service 8.1The Company will use reasonable diligence in attempting to provide continuous service. The Company shall not be liable for any loss, cost, damage or expense caused by any failure to supply electricity according to the terms of a contract, or by any interruption of the supply of electricity, reversal of the service, variation in voltage or by any other failure, when such failures are due to acts of God, public enemies, accidents, strikes, riots, wars, extraordinary repairs, operating necessities, orders of Court or other Governmental authority, or to any other acts or conditions reasonably beyond the control of the Company. 8.2In the event of an emergency threatening the integrity of its system, the Company may, without liability, interrupt, curtail, or suspend service. 8.3Restoration of service shall be without discrimination as between wholesale and retail customers in the same area in like circumstances, taking into account the types of service rendered by the Customer to its members or retail customers. 8.4The Company reserves the right, subject to the limitations, if any, of the Federal Power Act and Regulations duly issued thereunder, to discontinue the supply of electricity to the Customer in accordance with the provisions hereof. Except as may otherwise be provided by contract, the Company will give to the Customer fifteen (15) days prior written notice before any such discontinuance of the supply of electricity. If the supply of electricity has been discontinued by the Company, as a result of the non-compliance by the Customer with the terms and conditions of this tariff and Rules and Regulations, the Customer s service will not be reconnected until such non-compliance on the part of the Customer shall have been remedied. 8.4.1Whenever the supply of electricity is discontinued in accordance herewith, the Company will not be liable for any damages, direct or indirect, that may result from such discontinuance. 9.Emergency Load Control 9.1Whenever: (1) the demands for power on all or part of the Company s system exceed or threaten to exceed the capacity then actually and lawfully available to supply such demand; (2) system instability or cascading outages could result from actual or expected transmission overloads or other contingencies; or (3) such conditions exist in the system of another public utility or power pool with which the Company s system is interconnected that cause a reduction in the capacity available to the Company from that source or threaten the integrity of the Company s system, a load emergency situation exists. In such case, the Company shall take such reasonable steps as the time available permits to bring the demands within the then-available capacity or otherwise control load. Such steps shall include, but shall not be limited to, reduction or interruption of service to one or more Customers in accordance with the Company s procedures for controlling load as filled with appropriate regulatory agencies. 9.2The company shall establish procedures for controlling load, including schedules of load shedding priorities to be followed in compliance with the foregoing paragraph. 9.3If a load emergency situation as set forth in Section 10.1 should exist, the Company shall, as soon as practicable, advise Customers by telephone of the load emergency situation, and to the extent the information is available, of its nature and expected duration. 10.Metering 10.1For the purpose of measuring or obtaining such information as it may require for billing purposes, the Company may select and use any type of metering equipment, provided it meets the accuracy requirements of the appropriate regulatory agencies. 11.Connections with Other Power Sources 11.1For purposes of maintaining System safety and reliability if the Customer has an electrical power supply other than the Company s, no connection shall be made between that supply and the Company s facilities, except after reasonable notice and agreement between the Customer and the Company on such measures or conditions, if any, as may be required for the safety and reliability of both Systems. Service supplied by the Company shall not be used for emergency, standby, or breakdown service or as reserve service to another source of supply except where otherwise provided by contract or by the Company s written consent. 12.Billing and Payment 12.1Bills for service will be rendered at regular monthly intervals in accordance with the then effective applicable rate schedule set out in this FERC Electric Tariff, and shall be due upon presentation. 12.2If service is supplied to the Customer while the metering is defective, the Customer shall pay for service on the basis of an estimate arrived at by a mutually satisfactory method. 12.3Late payment charges will be applied as provided in the applicable Rate Schedule set out herein if all previous undisputed bills have not been paid in full. If bills are paid by mail, the date of the postmark will be considered the date of payment. 13.Excess Facilities 13.1The rates in this tariff are based on the Customer connecting to existing facilities of the Company. If the Company is required to extend its lines or build any additional facilities beyond those required for normal service to enable it to render service as requested to the Customer, the Customer shall pay for the cost of such extensions or facilities in addition to his monthly bill for electric service. This facility charge shall be at the rate of 2.1% per month of the additional cost. 14.Transfer of Agreement 14.1The Agreement between Customer and the Company is transferable only with the Company s written consent.
record_data.filing_title: West Penn Power Company Baseline Tariff filing

record_data.record_plain_text: RATE SCHEDULE WS-HV (C) WHOLESALE SERVICE AVAILABILITY This schedule applies to electric service sold to Customers who purchase electric energy for resale. Customers must have facilities to receive real-time load signals. Service will be supplied under an Electric Service Agreement setting forth the financial conditions covering the extension of service, the period of service and the conditions of supply. CHARACTER OF SERVICE DELIVERED UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Alternating current service having the following characteristics: 34,500 volts and over, 60 cycles, three phase. MONTHLY RATE Customer Charge $500.00 Net Kilowatt Demand Charge $11.955 Net per kilowatt Energy Charge $.01914 Net per kilowatt-hour Automatic Tax Adjustment An adjustment for tax changes shall apply, as appropriate, to the kilowatt-hours or kilowatts billed under this rate schedule. Rates to be adjusted, as required, by including an automatic pass-through of changes in federal, state, or local taxes or tax rates by providing an automatic adjustment of all taxes, upward or downward, based on actual tax expense incurred by West Penn. For changes in tax expense related to the Federal Corporate Income Tax rate, the appropriate dollar amount shall be applied to all schedules on an apportioned demand basis. For all other taxes or tax rate changes, unless otherwise agreed to by the Parties, the appropriate dollar amount shall be applied to all schedules on an apportioned kilowatt-hour basis. Fuel Cost Adjustment A fuel cost adjustment shall apply to all kilowatt-hours billed under this rate schedule. The adjustment shall be determined by the following formula to the nearest 0.001 cent per kilowatt-hour: A={ Fm Fb} x L x 1 Sm Sb 1-T A = Fuel cost adjustment in cents per kilowatt-hour. Fm = Fuel cost in the current period relating to: (a)Fossil and nuclear fuel consumed in generation in wholly-owned and jointly-owned stations and identifiable fossil and nuclear fuel costs in energy purchased plus the net energy cost of energy purchased on an economic dispatch basis less (b)Fossil and nuclear fuel costs recovered through intersystem sales. All fuel costs will be those charged to Account 501, cleared through Account 151, and Account 518 in the second calendar month preceding the billing month. Sm = All kilowatt-hour sales to regular customers in the current period. Fb and Sb = Fuel and kilowatt-hour sales in the base period as defined above. The factor Fb = 1.200 cent per kilowatt-hour. Sb L = Adjustment factor to recognize losses to service voltage where different than average losses in the delivery system. This factor is 0.97. T = The Gross Receipts Tax rate in effect during the billing month, expressed as a decimal. Late Payment Charge A late payment charge of 2% of the bill on the above net rates, including the Fuel Cost Adjustment, will be made for failure to make payment in full within 15 days of the date of a bill. DETERMINATION OF CUSTOMER S DEMAND The Customer s kilowatt demand for any month shall be the maximum thirty minute kilowatt demand that occurs coincident with the West Penn Power Company s monthly system peak kilowatt demand. The Customer s kilowatt demand shall not be less than the higher of the following: (a)15,000 kilowatts. (b)40% of the kilowatt capacity specified in the Electric Service Agreement. (c)40% of the highest Customer s kilowatt demand established in the Term of the Electric Service Agreement. GENERAL The coincident kilowatt demand and kilowatt-hours delivered to the Borough of Chambersburg at its three service connections on this schedule will be added and minor energy return to the Company subtracted and the net kilowatt demand and kilowatt-hours will be billed to the Customer. The Company s Rules and Regulations which govern the supply of wholesale service, as included in this FERC tariff and as changed from time to time, apply to this Schedule and are hereby incorporated by reference. Nothing contained herein shall be construed as affecting in any way the right of any party hereto to unilaterally make application to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for a change in rates under Section 205 or 206 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to the Commission s Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder. If Customer terminates or cancels service under the Tariff, the Customer shall remain responsible for its share of any legitimate and verifiable stranded investment costs related to the service Customer purchases under this Schedule as may be permitted by applicable federal or state rules and regulations, policies or interpretation. TERM As provided in the Electric Service Agreement but not less than one year.
record_data.filing_title: West Penn Power Company Baseline Tariff filing

record_data.record_plain_text: RATE SCHEDULE WS-HV WHOLESALE SERVICE AVAILABILITY This schedule applies to electric service sold to Customers who purchase electric energy for resale. Service will be supplied under an Electric Service Agreement setting forth the financial conditions covering the extension of service, the period of service and the conditions of supply. CHARACTER OF SERVICE DELIVERED UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Alternating current service having the following characteristics: 34,500 volts and over, 60 cycles, three phase. MONTHLY RATE Customer Charge $314.00 Net Kilowatt Demand Charge $10.655 Net per kilowatt Energy Charge $.01855 net per kilowatt-hour Automatic Tax Adjustment An adjustment for tax changes shall apply, as appropriate, to the kilowatt-hours or kilowatts billed under this rate schedule. Rates to be adjusted, as required, by including an automatic pass-through of changes in federal, state, or local taxes or tax rates by providing an automatic adjustment of all taxes, upward or downward, based on actual tax expense incurred by West Penn. For changes in tax expense related to the Federal Corporate Income Tax rate, the appropriate dollar amount shall be applied to all schedules on an apportioned demand basis. For all other taxes or tax rate changes, unless otherwise agreed to by the Parties, the appropriate dollar amount shall be applied to all schedules on an apportioned kilowatt-hour basis. Fuel Cost Adjustment A fuel cost adjustment shall apply to all kilowatt-hours billed under this rate schedule. The adjustment shall be determined by the following formula to the nearest 0.001 cent per kilowatt-hour: A={ Fm Fb} x L x 1 Sm Sb 1-T A = Fuel cost adjustment in cents per kilowatt-hour. Fm = Fuel cost in the current period relating to: (a)Fossil and nuclear fuel consumed in generation in wholly-owned and jointly-owned stations and identifiable fossil and nuclear fuel costs in energy purchased plus the net energy cost of energy purchased on an economic dispatch basis less (b)Fossil and nuclear fuel costs recovered through intersystem sales. All fuel costs will be those charged to Account 501, cleared through Account 151, and Account 518 in the second calendar month preceding the billing month. Sm = All kilowatt-hour sales to regular customers in the current period. Fb and Sb = Fuel and kilowatt-hour sales in the base period as defined above. The factor Fb = 1.200 cent per kilowatt-hour. Sb L = Adjustment factor to recognize losses to service voltage where different than average losses in the delivery system. This factor is 0.97. T = The Gross Receipts Tax rate in effect during the billing month, expressed as a decimal. Late Payment Charge A late payment charge of 2% of the bill on the above net rates, including the Fuel Cost Adjustment, will be made for failure to make payment in full within 15 days of the date of a bill. DETERMINATION OF CUSTOMER S DEMAND Customer s Kilowatt Demand The Customer s kilowatt demand for any month shall be the maximum sixty minute kilowatt demand. The Customer s kilowatt demand shall not be less than the highest of the following: (a)2,000 kilowatts. (b)40% of the kilowatt capacity specified in the Electric Service Agreement. (c)40% of the highest Customer s kilowatt demand established in the Term of the Electric Service Agreement. GENERAL The Company s Rules and Regulations which govern the supply of wholesale service, as included in this FERC tariff and as changed from time to time, apply to this Schedule and are hereby incorporated by reference. Nothing contained herein shall be construed as affecting in any way the right of any party hereto to unilaterally make application to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for a change in rates under Section 205 or 206 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to the Commission s Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder. If Customer terminates or cancels service under the Tariff, the Customer shall remain responsible for its share of any legitimate and verifiable stranded investment costs related to the service Customer purchases under this Schedule as may be permitted by applicable federal or state rules and regulations, policies or interpretation. TERM As provided in the Electric Service Agreement but not less than one year.
record_data.filing_title: West Penn Power Company Baseline Tariff filing

record_data.record_plain_text: ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE SERVICE AVAILABILITY Available for each single point of service to Electric Cooperatives for loads of not less than 300 kilowatts at each point of delivery. This schedule applies to electric service sold to Customers who purchase electric energy for resale. Service will be supplied under an Electric Service Agreement setting forth the financial conditions covering the extension of service, the period of service, and the conditions of supply. CHARACTER OF SERVICE DELIVERED UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Alternating current service having the following characteristics: Various Voltage Levels, 60 Cycles, Three Phase MONTHLY RATE FOR EACH POINT OF SERVICE Customer Charge $191.00 Net Demand Charge $12.005 Net per kilowatt Energy Charge $.01914 Net per kilowatt-hour Reactive Kilovolt-Ampere Charge $.25 Net per reactive kilovolt-ampere of Customer s Reactive Kilovolt-Ampere Demand in excess of 35% of Customer s Kilowatt Demand Transformer Charge When Customer desires to take service under this Schedule at a voltage between 1,000 and 15,000 volts, Company shall provide one transformation at a charge of $.375 net per kilowatt of the Customer s kilowatt demand for any month, as defined below, but not less than any such coincident peak demand previously established during the Term of the Electric Service Agreement. Voltage Discount If requested, the Company will furnish service at voltages above 100,000 volts at each location if such service at that location is over 10,000 kilowatts, is provided at a single delivery point from the Company s transmission system, is the only service on that account, and if in the sole judgment of the Company, the necessary capacity is available. When such service is supplied and the Customer owns and maintains all required facilities, the following discounts will be allowed but in no case will the amount of the minimum bill be hereby reduced. First 8,000 kilowatts of Customer s Demand . . . .66 cents net per kilowatt Additional kilowatts of Customer s Demand . . . . 22 cents net per kilowatt To qualify for this transmission voltage service, the Customer s demand must be at least 8,000 kilowatts at least once in every 12-month period at each metering point. Automatic Tax Adjustment An adjustment for tax changes shall apply, as appropriate, to the kilowatt-hours or kilowatts billed under this rate schedule. Rates to be adjusted, as required, by including an automatic pass-through of changes in federal, state, or local taxes or tax rates by providing an automatic adjustment of all taxes, upward or downward, based on actual tax expense incurred by West Penn. For changes in tax expense related to the Federal Corporate Income Tax rate, the appropriate dollar amount shall be applied to all schedules on an apportioned demand basis. For all other taxes or tax rate changes, unless otherwise agreed to by the Parties, the appropriate dollar amount shall be applied to all schedules on an apportioned kilowatt-hour basis. Fuel Cost Adjustment A fuel cost adjustment shall apply to all kilowatt-hours billed under this rate schedule. The adjustment shall be determined by the following formula to the nearest 0.001 cent per kilowatt-hour: A={ Fm Fb} x L x 1 Sm Sb 1-T A = Fuel Cost Adjustment in cents per kilowatt-hour Fm = Fuel Cost in the current period relating to: (a) Fossil and nuclear fuel consumed in generation in wholly-owned and jointly-owned stations and identifiable fossil and nuclear fuel costs in energy purchased plus the net energy cost of energy purchased on an economic dispatch basis less (b)Fossil and nuclear fuel costs recovered through intersystem sales. All fuel costs will be those charged to Account 501, cleared through Account 151, and Account 518 in the second calendar month preceding the billing month Sm = All kilowatt-hour sales to regular customers in the current period. Fb and Sb = Fuel and kilowatt-hour sales in the base period as defined in the preceding. The factor Fb = 1.200 cent per kilowatt-hour Sb L = Adjustment factor to recognize losses to service voltage where different than average losses in the delivery system. This factor is 0.95 for service voltages above 69,000 volts, 0.97 for service voltages of 25,000-69,000 volts, and 1.00 for service voltages of 7200/12,470 volts and below. T = The Gross Receipts Tax rate in effect during the billing month, expressed as a decimal. The amount of fuel adjustment billed shall not be subject to any discounts Late Payment Charge A late payment charge of 2% of the bill on the above net rates, including the Fuel Cost Adjustment, will be made for failure to make payment in full within 15 days of the date of a bill. DETERMINATION OF CUSTOMER S DEMAND FOR EACH POINT OF SERVICE Customer s Kilowatt Demand The Customer s Kilowatt Demand for any calendar month shall be the maximum integrated clock hour kilowatt demand that occurs coincident with the West Penn Power Company s monthly system peak kilowatt demand. The Customer s coincident peak kilowatt demand shall not be less than the highest of the following: (a)240 kilowatts. (b)40% of the highest Customer s coincident peak billing Kilowatt Demand established for the 12 months prior to the billing month. Customer s Reactive Kilovolt-Ampere Demand The Customer s Reactive Kilovolt-Ampere Demand for any calendar month shall be the maximum one-hour leading or lagging reactive kilovolt-ampere demand. GENERAL The Company s Rules and Regulations which govern the supply of wholesale service, as included in this FERC tariff and as changed from time to time, apply to this Schedule and are hereby incorporated by reference. Except as specified in the Settlement Agreement, nothing contained herein shall be construed as affecting in any way the right of any party hereto to unilaterally make application to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for a change in rates under Section 205 or 206 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to the Commission s Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder. TERM As provided in the Electric Service Agreement, but not less than one year.
record_data.filing_title: West Penn Power Company Baseline Tariff filing
